349001. Kabaradini

Kakheti — Not random

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1490
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1500)

Description

In the 1480s, in a chapel he built by Qintsvisi cathedral, Zaza Panaskerteli-Tsitsishvili, a retired royal official, compiled a karabadini (book of medical treatment), fusing Galenic and Sumerian medicine with Georgian folklore. The work summarises the state of medical knowledge in Georgia and neighbouring cultures at the time.

Actions

A. OK

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +25
  • +500 population in the capital province

Back to top

349002. Invasion of Ismail

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Persia exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1500
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1525)

Description

The collapse of Georgia became an excellent pretext for Safavid Persia to consolidate its influence in the Caucasus. In 1500, Ismail incited the kings of Kartli and Kakheti to attack Tabriz, luring them with the abolition of tribute. But Ismail broke his promise, and made Kartli and Kakhetia his vassals. During the Turkish-Persian War, Kartli and Samtskhe were disputed territory and potential allies for both sides. Davit X took advantage of the defeat of Ismail and tried to free his country from paying tribute to the Kizilbash. In 1522, due to Davit X's refusal to convert to Islam, Shah Ismail captured Tbilisi. The city was looted, its churches burned and a mosque was hastily erected on the Avlabar bridge, the only river crossing. The city was recaptured after Ismail's death.

Actions

A. We need to survive the storm

  • Stability +1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Persia for 36 months
  • -250 relations with Persia
  • -50 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • +50 relations with Russia
  • +50 relations with Byzantium

B. Let the people believe what they want

  • Stability -1
  • +50 relations with Persia
  • +50 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • Innovativeness +1

C. Let us praise Allah

  • Stability -3
  • Change religion to shia
  • Change technology group to Muslim
  • Innovativeness -2
  • persian will become an accepted culture
  • georgian will no longer be an accepted culture
  • Break vassalization with -1
  • +100 relations with Persia
  • -100 relations with Russia
  • -100 relations with Byzantium
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

Back to top

349003. Evil George

Kakheti — Not random

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1511
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1513)

Description

George, the eldest son of King Alexander, was extremely grasping and ambitious, seeking to reunite eastern Georgia under Kakhetian rule. Giorgi's army raided Kartli, his father was killed. Giorgi killed his father, gouged his brother Demetre's eyes out and crowned himself Giorgi II 'King of Imeretia, Abkhazia, Armenia, Kartli and Kakhetia'. For two years the infamous 'Evil Giorgi' plagued Kartli. In 1513, he was captured by Bagrat Muhranbatoni and later killed in prison.

Actions

A. Curses!

  • Stability -3

Back to top

349008. Georgia threatened

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Persia exists
  • Ottoman Empire exists
  • Russia exists
  • Russia owns Asterxan
  • None of the following must occur:
    • Byzantium exists
    • Trebizond exists
    • Country has at least 7 non-colonial provinces

Will happen within 36 days of March 2, 1584
Checked again every 36 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1600)

Description

For centuries Georgia was an enclave of Christianity in the Caucasian mountains. As the last Byzantine states succumbed, the country became isolated from the rest of the world, surrounded by potential enemies and fighting feudal quarrels. As Persia emerged in the east and the Osman power grew in the west, Georgia was plunged into the front lines between the two titans. In the meantime Russia grew in strengh, having reached as far as Caspian Sea. Hoping to receive substantial aid and save his faith, Alexander, King of the still independent Kakheti, asked the tsar to become the overlord of Georgia.

Actions

A. Submit to Russia

  • Stability -1
  • +50 relations with Russia
  • -50 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • -25 relations with Persia
  • Break vassalization with Ottoman Empire
  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Break vassalization with Crimea
  • Break vassalization with Imereti
  • Event 271001 - Georgians ask our protection for Russia is triggered immediately

B. Rely on our strengh

  • Stability +2
  • -50
  • +2500 infantry in the capital province
  • +7500 cavalry in the capital province
  • -25 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • -25 relations with Persia
  • Offensive Doctrine +2
  • Innovativeness -1

C. Appease the infidels

  • Stability -2
  • +50 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • +50 relations with Persia
  • -100

Back to top

349005. Dasturlamali

Kakheti — Not random

Will happen within 360 days of March 2, 1590
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1600)

Description

Being a regent for his absent uncle, George XI, between 1704 and 1708 Vakhtang compiled a law code, the dasturlamali, which would operate as the basis for the Georgian feudal system until the Russian annexation. It ranked citizens by blood price: killing a peasant incurred a penalty of 12 tumans, a mid-ranking merchant or low-ranking nobleman, 48, a high-ranking merchant or mid-ranking nobleman, 96, the price doubling with rank, with a senior prince worth 1536 tumans.

Actions

A. OK

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +50
  • Gain courthouse in the capital province

Back to top

349004. Rule of Alexander II

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • Own Kakheti
  • Control Kakheti

Will happen within 360 days of March 2, 1590
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1600)

Description

Away from the confrontation between the Ottomans and Persians, Kakheti flourished under Alexander II. Palaces and churches were built. Agriculture flourished, as did trade with countries around the Caspian. Aleksandre even complained that a century of peace had made Kakhetia so overpopulated that there was too little game or uncultivated land for hunting.

Actions

A. Peaceful times

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +25
  • Trade tech investment: +25
  • +2000 population in Kakheti

Back to top

349013. Regicide in Kakheti

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 349011 - Russian aid arrives for Kakheti has already occurred
  • Persia owns Ardabil
  • Persia owns Hayastan
  • Persia controls Ardabil
  • Persia controls Hayastan

Will happen within 36 days of January 2, 1602
Checked again every 36 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1606)

Description

As Persia regained its strength it set an eye on its northern borderlands once again, into regions where Russia had expanded. Prince Konstantin, the son of Alexander of Kakheti, had been educated at the Persian court since he was young and converted to Shi'ite Islam. Shah Abbas ordered him to seize the throne and sent an army into Georgia to help fighting the Turks. Having a garrison of only forty russian soldiers Alexander could not dare to offend Abbas, whose Persians soon killed him along with his son Giorgi in order to enthrone Konstantin the very same day. Russia could not really interfere as it slowly but surely went into a civil war over its own throne.

Actions

A. Konstantin becomes King

  • Break vassalization with Russia
  • -50 relations with Russia
  • +50 relations with Persia
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Event 349100 - Konstantin becomes King for Kakheti is triggered immediately
  • Event 271002 - Konstantin is King of Georgia for Russia is triggered immediately

B. Alexander defies Abbas

  • -250 relations with Persia
  • Event 254013 - Persia claims Kakheti for Persia is triggered immediately

Back to top

349017. Teimuraz breaks with Abbas

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Kakheti is a vassal of Persia
  • Persia owns Ardabil
  • Persia owns Hayastan

Will happen within 36 days of January 2, 1610
Checked again every 36 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1614)

Description

Teimuraz I, another Christian King of Kakhetia, became King in 1606, and kept himself quite independent. Therefore, Shah Abbas of Persia invited him and Luarsab II of Kartli to a royal hunt. Keeping the fate of murdered King Alexander of Kakheti in mind Teimuraz refused. Infuriated, the shah gathered armies and moved towards Georgia. Teimuraz sent two of his sons to Abbas but the latter could not be appeased. Still refusing to arrive at the shah's camp personally he had to prepare for a war...

Actions

A. Teimuraz backs down and meets Abbas

  • Event 254014 - Georgia is on it's knees for Persia is triggered immediately
  • Stability -2

B. Abbas invades Georgia

  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Start a war with Persia
  • -250 relations with Persia

Back to top

349021. Revolt of David Jandieri

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 254015 - Revolt of David Jandieri for Persia has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1615
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after March 2, 1616)

Description

When the Kakhetine people had had enough of the Persian yoke a revolt started under David Jandieri. After its success King Teimuraz, who had been living in exile since Abbas annexed Kakheti, returned to the throne and joined the battle against Persia. Alas, in 1617 Abbas returned, even more determined than before. When Teimuraz fled once again Jandieri organized the nation's defense. There was not a single castle that capitulated without being taken by surprise.

Actions

A. Let us die as free men!

  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Start a war with Persia
  • -300 relations with Persia
  • Land tech investment: +500
  • +5000 infantry in the capital province
  • +5000 cavalry in the capital province

Back to top

349022. Abbas' revenge

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • Persia controls Kakheti
  • Event 254015 - Revolt of David Jandieri for Persia has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1615
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1625)

Description

When Abbas conquered Georgia after the revolts he did not show any mercy to the population. The rebels did not capitulate and Abbas took terrible revenge on them. Whole villages were burned and many people were deliberately killed. About 100,000 georgians were reported to have been killed while another 200,000 were deported far into Persia into Mazandaran and Hamadan, where their Islamizied descendants live today.

Actions

A. Woe upon Georgia!

  • Kakheti revolts
  • Kakheti revolts
  • -2 base tax value in Kakheti
  • -2000 population in Kakheti

Back to top

349050. Rostom, the Muslim King

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Kakheti is a vassal of Russia
  • The following must not occur:
    • Kakheti is a vassal of Ottoman Empire
  • Persia is a neighbor

Will happen within 200 days of January 2, 1632
Checked again every 200 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1655)

Description

Teimuraz made peace with Abbas, being accepted as the sole King of Kartli and Kakheti. When the shah died, though, Teimuraz was more than unsure if the new shah would also recognize him. Therefore he tried to help one of the candidates to become shah to ensure his gratitude. Sadly for him he chose the wrong one while Rostom, a descendant of a Kartlian Bagrationi subline living at the Persian court intrigued in favour of Safi, became the winning candidate. As he also was Muslim he seemed to be a perfect candidate in the eyes of the new shah to replace Teimuraz, who turned out to be a traitor. Thus an age of 'islamized' Kings of Georgia started, although they were wise enough not to try to enforce the new religion on the population.

Actions

A. Let the people believe what they want

  • Stability +1
  • +50 relations with Persia
  • Innovativeness +1
  • Event 254016 - Muslim Kings in Kartli and Kakheti for Persia is triggered immediately

B. Let us praise Allah

  • Stability -3
  • Change religion to shia
  • Change technology group to Muslim
  • Innovativeness -2
  • persian will become an accepted culture
  • georgian will no longer be an accepted culture
  • Break vassalization with Persia
  • Break vassalization with Russia
  • Break vassalization with Ottoman Empire
  • +100 relations with Persia
  • -100 relations with Russia
  • -100 relations with Byzantium
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts
  • Event 254016 - Muslim Kings in Kartli and Kakheti for Persia is triggered immediately

C. Let us reconvert and expel the oppressor

  • Stability -1
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Persia for 36 months
  • -250 relations with Persia
  • +50 relations with Russia
  • +50 relations with Byzantium

349006. Centralization reforms of Vakhtang

Kakheti — Not random

Will happen within 360 days of March 2, 1710
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1724)

Description

When Vakhtang VI came to power in 1716, he centralised royal power: towns became crown lands, the mint became a crown monopoly. Industries like silk production and dyeing became monopolies of Vakhtang and his Circassian queen Rusudan. Agriculture was revived by renovating irrigation systems. Viticulture expanded so much that hired labour was imported. Tbilisi regained its lost trade glory.

Actions

A. Renovate the country

  • Centralization +1
  • Mercantilism +1
  • Aristocracy -1

B. Respect eristavis

  • Centralization -1
  • Aristocracy +1

Back to top

349007. A Secret Catholic

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • State religion is orthodox

Will happen within 360 days of March 2, 1719
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1724)

Description

In 1714 Shah Hosein summoned Vakhtang to Kirman, cancelled his subsidy, dismissed his servants and detained him for denying Islam. While in prison, the king sent his maternal uncle, the scholar and writer Sulkhan-Saba Orbeliani, to Europe. He sent letters to the Pope and the King of France, pleading for pressure on the shah to release King Vakhtang, hinting that the Georgian Church might accept the pope's authority. The trip abroad was unsuccessful, as the Kartli nobles opposed the religious reforms. Vakhtang later admitted that he had been a secret Catholic for years.

Actions

A. Georgia remains Orthodox

  • Stability +1

B. Bring the Church under Papal Authority

  • Stability -3
  • Change religion to catholic
  • Innovativeness +1
  • +100 relations with Papal States
  • -100 relations with Russia
  • -100 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

Back to top

349052. Teimuraz and Irakli

Kakheti — Not random

Conditions

  • State religion is shia

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1732
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1795)

Description

In 1732 the shah appointed Teimuraz II as the King of Kartli, while his nephew Irakli became the King of Kakheti, causing the defacto unification of the two Kingdoms. Another remarkable thing was that both were crowned in Christian ritual, which made them the first Christian Kings in Kartli and Kakheti since Rostom's times.

Actions

A. A century of Islam is over

  • Stability +2
  • -50 relations with Persia
  • +100 relations with Russia
  • Change religion to orthodox
  • Change technology group to Orthodox
  • A random province converts to the state religion
  • georgian will become an accepted culture
  • persian will no longer be an accepted culture
  • Innovativeness +1

B. Christianity is dead in Georgia

  • georgian will become an accepted culture
  • persian will no longer be an accepted culture
  • +100 relations with Persia
  • Innovativeness -1

Back to top

349053. Kartli and Kakheti united

Kakheti — Not random

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1762
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 12, 1798)

Description

In 1762, Teimuraz II. of Kartli died. His nephew, Irakli II. of Kakheti finally could unite both east-Georgian Kingdoms into one realm, which once again became known as Georgia. Irakli pursued a strict policy of limiting the local feudals' power, tried to turn Georgia into an absolutist state and seeked contact with Russia and Imereti to fight off persian hegemony.

Actions

A. Proclaim an united Georgia

  • Stability +1
  • Flag graphics set to default
  • Become Georgia
  • +70 relations with Russia
  • +70 relations with Imereti
  • Aristocracy -3
  • Centralization +4
  • Innovativeness +2
  • Tbilisi will be considered a national province

B. Rule Kartli-Kakheti in personal union

  • Stability +2
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Centralization -1
